page.title: 09LANDMARKS IN LANGRISH (2)
page.content: Langrish first came into existence in the 1400s,when Bordean House was built by Roger Langrish. The Langrish family were on Cromwell's side during the Civil War and afterwards moved to Ireland where their descendants still live. The village is famous for the two Victoria Crosses won by villagers during the First World War. The first was won by Sergeant E.G.Horlock in 1915. Sadly, he was later killed on service. The second was won by Admiral E.G. Robinson. There is only one public building in Langrish-The Church.The residents of Langrish want to convert part of it into a Community Centre, and money has been raised by the book 'We Like Langrish, Ramsdean too!' written and edited by the residents of those two villages.
